name: Sharon's Egg and Ham Scramble
author: Dinner Date
summary: This is my original recipe, although there might be a zillion egg recipes very similar to it. The number of servings depends upon your appetite and what else is on the table to go with it.
ingredients: 3 tablespoons milk, or more to taste
¼ teaspoon seasoned salt (such as Season-All®)
salt and ground black pepper to taste
½ cup chopped deli slices applewood-smoked ham
1 cup finely shredded Cheddar cheese, divided
directions: Beat eggs, milk, seasoned salt, salt, and black pepper together in a bowl
Heat olive oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat; saute jalapeno in hot oil until slightly softened, 2 to 3 minutes
Add ham to jalapeno and cook until heated through, about 1 minute
Pour egg mixture into ham mixture
Cook and stir until eggs are set but not dry, 3 to 5 minutes
Sprinkle 1/2 of the Cheddar cheese over eggs; cook and stir until cheese is melted
Transfer eggs to a plate and sprinkle remaining cheese over the top
